items.title: Wabtec Acquires Evident’s Inspection Tech Division
items.summary:
- **Wabtec** completed the acquisition of **Evident’s Inspection Technologies**, boosting its *Digital Intelligence* offerings.
- The $1.78 billion deal expands Wabtec's market reach, increasing its *Total Addressable Market* from $8B to $16B, focusing on *advanced diagnostics* and *automation*.
- This strategic move is expected to deliver *immediate shareholder value*, with *growth*, improved margins, and *recurring revenue* advantages in high-growth sectors.

items.title: Defining AI literacy in the quality profession
items.author: Greg@800Compete.com (Greg Hutchins)
items.summary:
• **AI literacy** is now the top skill for quality professionals, enabling them to effectively integrate AI into workflows. 
• The role of *AI assurance* and *human in the loop* will grow, where quality experts validate and explain AI decisions, ensuring fairness and transparency. 
• New regulations like the EU AI Act require *risk management* and *quality systems* for high-risk AI, presenting big opportunities for quality professionals to lead compliance and design controls. 

*The quality field is evolving with AI, creating new roles for professionals to thrive by focusing on trust, risk, and governance.*

items.title: Beyond the Factory Floor: Smarter Tools for U.S. Manufacturing Quality Control
items.author: media@faro.com (Daniel Teigman)
items.summary:
- The Golden Age of U.S. manufacturing spanned from the late 1940s to early 1980s with high employment and union membership, but manufacturing today faces a 35% employment decline and new challenges.  
- Today’s manufacturing success depends on faster, smarter training and quality delivery, powered by *portable 3D scanning and probing technologies* which simplify inspection, boost productivity, and reduce waste.  
- These *intuitive 3D tools* reduce the learning curve and ease skills development, fueling a tech-enabled workforce through apprenticeships and academic partnerships, ensuring the future competitiveness of American manufacturing.

items.title: Man of Steel: Missouri S&T Graduate Confirms New Methods to Reduce Steel Defects
items.summary:
*A Missouri S&T Ph.D. graduate has developed innovative methods to reduce steel defects during production.*
- His research improves steel processing by enhancing heat treatment, pouring, and cooling techniques, making parts more reliable and reducing waste.
- *The spray quenching method* provides more even cooling, fewer cracks, and is safer and more sustainable than traditional methods, promising benefits across manufacturing industries.

items.title: PODCAST | Why Should We Position Manufacturing Quality at the Center of Our Businesses
Quality Skills, Training That Stands the Test of Time in Manufacturing
Advancements in Industrial X-Ray Computed Tomography
items.author: Paul Brackman
items.summary:
- *Industrial X-Ray computed tomography (CT)* modernizes aerospace manufacturing by increasing inspection speed, repeatability, and defect detection accuracy, helping to address a historic backlog of over 17,000 unfilled aircraft orders.  
- Unlike legacy nondestructive evaluation (NDE) methods, digital X-ray CT efficiently captures *complete 3D data* requiring less skilled labor and automates defect detection with AI, increasing accuracy by up to 50%.  
- The resulting *digital twins* enable process improvement through data archiving, enhanced supplier traceability, and accelerated additive manufacturing workflows, positioning aerospace firms for a more agile, digitally integrated future.

items.title: The Role of Microtesters in Materials Testing Today
Motivation at the Workplace
items.author: yves.vannuland@comatech.be (Yves Van Nuland PhD)
items.summary: - The article presents the Prima method to diagnose and improve **employee motivation** by identifying and addressing 20 common symptoms of poor motivation through structured team activities. - Motivation depends on the C.A.R. model: **Competence, Autonomy, and Relationships**, with a strong emphasis on constructive leadership behaviors that foster trust, appreciation, and collaboration. - Effective leadership transformation from **defensive to constructive thinking styles** has significant impact in overcoming motivational barriers and improving workplace culture with concrete, actionable plans.

items.title: AI in Quality Management: Hype vs. Reality
Cost of Quality Implementation: A Practical Approach
items.author: htang2@emich.edu (Dr. Herman Tang)
items.summary:
- The article explains *Cost of Quality (COQ)* fundamentals and two main models: the *Prevention-Appraisal-Failure (PAF)* model and the *Process Cost Model (PCM)*, providing frameworks for classifying quality-related costs.  
- It presents simple, spreadsheet-based methods to implement COQ tracking for small and mid-sized businesses, enabling continuous improvement and better alignment of quality initiatives with financial goals.  
- Analysis of COQ trends helps identify opportunities to optimize between investing in prevention/appraisal and reducing failure costs, supporting strategic decisions to improve *quality* and reduce expenses.

items.title: Kitov AI and FANUC America Form Strategic AI-Driven Manufacturing Partnership
items.summary:
- **FANUC America and Kitov AI** have partnered to combine robotics with AI-powered visual inspection for *smart manufacturing* enhancements.
- The collaboration aims to improve *quality control, production efficiency,* and *operational flexibility* across automotive, aerospace, electronics, and medical sectors.
- Joint solutions focus on *automated quality inspection, assembly validation,* and *dimensional metrology*, showcased at OptiPro Open House.

items.title: Best Practice Nondestructive Testing for EV Battery Packs
items.summary:
- **Electric vehicle battery packs** require rigorous *100% leak testing* to prevent catastrophic failures such as fires caused by water ingress or electrolyte leakage.  
- The **Equivalent Channel (EC) method** and **helium leak testing** are advanced nondestructive techniques adopted to meet the IEC IPX7 water ingress standard and ensure leak tightness in battery pack manufacturing.  
- SAE International has established recommended practices (SAE J3277) to standardize leak testing, improving quality assurance and consumer safety as EV sales rapidly increase worldwide.

items.title: Cultivating an Innovation Mindset for Creativity, Quality and Progress
items.summary: - An *innovation mindset* is essential for progress, involving creative problem-solving, resilience, curiosity, and adapting to change, with tools like TRIZ aiding systematic innovation. - Embracing failure as feedback, fostering *psychological safety*, and applying principles like the Trimming Principle can drive transformation and quality improvement across industries. - Leadership commitment, continuous questioning, and reframing obstacles as opportunities are crucial to cultivating a culture of *innovation* and sustaining quality in a rapidly evolving world.

items.title: Tariffs Trigger Shifts in Supply Chains and Quality Strategy
items.author: Genevieve Diesing
items.summary:
- Tariffs are accelerating U.S. manufacturers' reshoring efforts and increasing the complexity of supply chains, which drives a greater focus on *quality assurance* and automation investments.  
- Supply chain disruptions compel quality teams to take a central role in sourcing decisions, increasing oversight and demanding tighter inspection and validation processes.  
- Digital quality management systems and lean principles help companies maintain *stability* and adaptability amid rapid supplier changes, positioning quality assurance as a strategic lever during ongoing trade disruptions.

items.title: ISO 10012 Revision Update
items.author: jvdbd@hotmail.com (John Vandenbemden)
items.summary:
- The **ISO 10012** standard, for measurement management systems, is undergoing a major revision to shift from a guideline to a certifiable standard.
- The update addresses the **need for robust measurement quality** systems across organizations of all sizes, not replacing ISO 15025 but complementing it.
- The revision process, begun four years ago, is near completion with active resolution of DIS comments before submission by the June 1, 2025 deadline.

items.title: Automated Calibration Systems Improve Manufacturing Accuracy
items.author: Genevieve Diesing
items.summary:
- **Automated calibration systems** enhance manufacturing precision by reducing manual steps and speeding up measurement processes across sensors, CNC machines, and CMMs.  
- Innovations like **multi-laser systems**, **self-regulating handheld tools**, and integrated control software improve accuracy, compliance, and ease of use.  
- Challenges include operator training and sensor mounting, but *integration with production software* and data management best practices enable predictive maintenance and quality improvements.  
- Future trends point to full automation, cloud data, AI integration, and expanded use of digital sensors and robot calibration.

items.title: ‘Stressing’ the Importance of Quality in Manufacturing
items.summary:
- Patrick Jester shares how rapid corporate growth and increased responsibilities escalated his stress, affecting his health and work quality in the *quality management* field.
- He highlights a major industry trend where *quality budgets* are minimal until crises occur, then blamed for issues, emphasizing quality should be viewed as a *profit center* rather than a cost.
- The discussion calls for a mindset shift to recognize quality as a *value-add* that *defends profits* and improves business outcomes, not merely a cost or liability.

items.title: Medical Manufacturing Technologies Acquires Comco to Boost Microblasting
items.summary:
- **Medical Manufacturing Technologies (MMT)** has acquired **Comco**, a leader in micro-precision sandblasting, to enhance its abrasive technology and microblasting capabilities.
- Comco's patented MicroBlaster® technology delivers precise, repeatable, and eco-friendly microblasting, widely used in medical, aerospace, and microelectronics industries.
- The acquisition aligns both companies' focus on innovation, quality, and customer support, with Comco’s President joining MMT to drive growth and collaboration.

items.title: An Organized Advocacy Approach to Moving Manufacturing Quality Forward
items.summary: - David Robinson, Director of External Affairs at Manufacturing Renaissance, highlights the *urgent skills gap* and *funding challenges* in U.S. manufacturing, especially for small to medium-sized companies. - There's *uncertainty* in manufacturing investment and reshoring due to long timelines and financial demands. - The *American Manufacturing Renaissance Act* proposes $12 billion to support community coalitions, education, and industry growth at the national level.

items.title: Calibrating Humidity for Data Centers
items.author: Abhishek Kamerkar
items.summary:
- *Maintaining precise humidity control* in data centers is critical to prevent electrostatic discharge and condensation damage, following ASHRAE TC 9.9 guidelines (40-60% RH).
- *Proper calibration of humidity sensors* is essential as sensor drift can cause costly downtime, SLA violations, and excess energy use.
- Data centers face *calibration challenges* due to security, logistics, and the choice between in-house and outsourced calibration, with in-house offering better control and compliance documentation.

items.title: Determining Settling Time in Measurement Systems – An Analytical Approach
items.author: frank.liebmann@flukecal.com (Frank Leibmann)
items.summary: - The article presents an *analytical method* to determine *settling time* in measurement systems exhibiting exponential decay transients, aiming to optimize measurement timing and reduce errors. - It uses the *ratio of successive slopes* (first derivatives) to calculate the *time constant* and predict when the system has sufficiently settled for accurate readings. - Practical examples include RC circuits and temperature decay data, with cautions on handling *noisy data* and *complex transient behaviors* to ensure reliable automation.

items.title: High QA Joins InnovMetric PolyWorks Digital Thread Partnership
Link Quality and Lean, Part 2
items.author: smith_jim_l@cat.com (Jimmy L. Smith)
items.summary: - Explores how to *integrate quality improvement and lean manufacturing* in product and process redesign to *maximize customer value* by reducing waste and variation. - Emphasizes starting from the *customer's perspective* and the importance of a clear *roadmap and accurate measurement* to successfully implement lean initiatives like kaizen. - Highlights that quality and lean are *complementary* and should be pursued together to improve *throughput, reduce defects,* and achieve market competitiveness.

items.title: Ensuring Coating Quality: The Power of XRF Analysis in High-Tech Manufacturing
items.author: damien.blondel@evidentscientific.com (Damien Blondel Ph.D.)
items.summary: - *X-ray fluorescence (XRF)* provides a nondestructive, fast, and precise method for measuring coating thickness and composition, essential in aerospace, automotive, medical devices, and energy sectors. - Handheld and in-line XRF analyzers enable real-time quality control with minimal sample prep and high accuracy. - XRF supports compliance, durability, and sustainability by detecting multilayer coatings and ensuring coatings meet stringent standards.

items.title: The State of the Profession in 2025
items.author: bangertm@bnpmedia.com (Michelle Bangert)
items.summary: - The *quality profession* is evolving with increased investment and rising importance amid supply chain and regulatory challenges. - *AI adoption* is nearly universal in quality management, signaling a future firmly integrating technology. - Despite advances, there is ongoing concern about *deskilling* and the need to maintain *fundamental quality principles* in manufacturing.

items.title: A Whistleblower Speaking Truth to Power
items.summary:
- Whistleblowers protect public interest by exposing misconduct, leading to *policy changes* and *greater accountability* across sectors like aviation and government.
- The author emphasizes the importance of ethics, strategic whistleblowing, and protections like the *Whistleblower Protection Act* and *AIR21* in safeguarding safety and integrity.
- Despite risks such as retaliation, whistleblowing fosters a *culture of integrity* essential for transparency, safety, and organizational reform.

items.title: Blum-Novotest Opens New Competence Center in Erlanger, KY to Enhance Regional Support
items.summary: Blum-Novotest has launched a new Competence Center in Erlanger, KY, serving as a technical hub for the Americas to provide rapid, tailored measuring solutions and optimize supply chain processes. This expansion strengthens support for advanced manufacturing and automation in the U.S. market.

items.title: Beyond the Measurement: How Data Management Software Can Transform Modern Manufacturing
items.author: Hany Abdel-Motaleb
items.summary: - **Measurement data software** goes beyond recording values by capturing *contextual data* like operator, conditions, and equipment for full *traceability*. - *Real-time data* empowers spotting defects early, reducing scrap and rework through continuous Statistical Process Control (SPC). - Choosing **scalable, reliable software** that integrates diverse tools ensures future growth and smoother audits, overcoming initial implementation challenges.

items.title: Hexagon Announces Octave as Name for Potential 2026 Spin-Off
items.summary: Hexagon AB plans to spin off its Asset Lifecycle Intelligence, Safety, Infrastructure & Geospatial divisions into a new software and SaaS company named Octave by 2026. Octave aims to enhance data-driven decision-making and customer outcomes across industrial and public sectors.

items.title: US Cutting Tool Orders Reach $212.8M in April 2025 with Modest Growth from March
items.summary: US cutting tool orders in April 2025 totaled $212.8 million, rising 2.7% from March but down 2.8% year-over-year amid tariff uncertainties. Industry leaders anticipate clearer trade policies and a manufacturing rebound in the latter half of 2025, signaling cautious optimism for growth.

items.title: Precise Measurement of Spacing Between Cylindrical Bores Using Differential Air Gaging
items.author: Marketing.pvd@mahr.com (Farzad Azimi)
items.summary: This article explains how differential air gaging precisely measures center-to-center distances between cylindrical bores, crucial for mechanical integrity in engines and turbines. Leveraging airflow back pressure changes, this noncontact method ensures rapid, accurate, and reliable dimensional checks essential for quality manufacturing.

items.title: The ASSEMBLY Show Announces Keynote Speaker Joanna Cooper and Opens 2025 Registration
items.summary: The ASSEMBLY Show 2025, co-located with SMTA International in Rosemont, IL, features Joanna Cooper of Daimler Truck North America as keynote speaker discussing innovation and agility in manufacturing. Attendees gain access to cutting-edge assembly technologies, quality solutions, and valuable networking opportunities.

items.title: Leveraging Internal Auditing to Address Climate Change in Organizations
items.author: Roderick A Munro
items.summary: The article emphasizes integrating climate change considerations into internal auditing processes, especially for companies aligned with ISO 14001 or ISO 50001. It outlines practical steps for auditing infrastructure, equipment, transportation, and ICT to reduce greenhouse gas emissions, highlighting the evolving role of auditors in sustainability efforts.

items.title: Automation Enhances Quality Assurance in Catalyst Pellet Testing
items.author: info@mecmesin.com (Robert Egginton)
items.summary: Automation in quality assurance, particularly for catalyst pellet crush strength testing, improves consistency, efficiency, and data integrity while reducing human error. This strategic investment supports smarter manufacturing, enabling higher throughput and compliance with industry standards, crucial for the energy sector’s evolving demands.

items.title: Hexagon Unveils Autonomous Metrology Suite
Promess Announces Promotion of Lytle to President
ISO 19011: Your Best Friend You Didn’t Know About
Martin Jomphe Named Divisional VP of Creaform Engineering and Crank Software
items.summary: Martin Jomphe has been appointed Divisional Vice President of Creaform Engineering and Crank Software, combining leadership of two innovative teams to drive strategic growth and enhance client service delivery worldwide. His extensive experience and integrated approach position Creaform as a leader in product engineering and embedded GUI solutions.

items.title: PODCAST | AI-Powered Robotics in Quality Manufacturing
WCQI: More Than a Conference, a Global Networking Experience
items.author: Jim Spichiger
items.summary: The ASQ's WCQI conference in Denver offered a blend of high-level education and exceptional global networking, attracting attendees from over 30 countries. Its inclusive and interactive format fostered strong community connections and personal growth, making it invaluable for quality professionals seeking both knowledge and meaningful industry relationships.

items.title: Investing in Skills Today Ensures a Competitive Edge Tomorrow
items.author: Baksh7@Outlook.com (Tash Baksh)
items.summary: Specialized skills and hands-on experience are becoming crucial for young adults entering the workforce, offering faster, cost-effective pathways to well-paying careers. Entry-level training and certifications bridge the skills gap, especially in technology, healthcare, and trades, ensuring a strong, competitive workforce for the future.

items.title: Upcoming IA9100 Series Standards Modernize Aerospace Quality Management
items.author: inquiry.msamericas@bsigroup.com (David Harvey)
items.summary: The 2026 IA9100 series updates introduce comprehensive revisions to aerospace quality standards, emphasizing predictive process control, product safety, cybersecurity, sustainability, and human factors. These changes respond to evolving industry challenges, helping organizations secure compliance while enhancing reliability and customer trust in a digitally connected, environmentally conscious era.

items.title: MVTec and Siemens Enhance Industrial Automation Through Expanded Partnership
items.summary: MVTec Software GmbH and Siemens have strengthened their collaboration to improve machine vision applications by integrating Siemens' robust industrial PCs with MVTec's advanced machine vision software, HALCON. This partnership enhances performance and seamless hardware-software interaction, enabling more efficient and innovative industrial automation solutions.

items.title: Nissan Smyrna Plant Tour Highlights Quality and Innovation in Automotive Manufacturing
items.summary: Nissan's Smyrna plant showcases advanced automation and quality initiatives, including extensive use of collaborative robots and virtual reality to enhance production. The plant plays a critical role in Nissan's shift to domestic manufacturing, underscoring its commitment to innovation and high-quality vehicle assembly. This tour reveals significant industry trends in automotive manufacturing technology and strategy.

items.title: Coherix Launches Coherix CARES Service Program for Robotic Adhesive Dispensing Systems
items.summary: Coherix introduces Coherix CARES, a subscription-based service program offering training, technical support, and system maintenance for robotic adhesive dispensing in automotive and electronics manufacturing. This program aims to reduce downtime and waste while optimizing production efficiency, initially targeting North American customers with global expansion planned.

items.title: Seeq Appoints Ray Scheppach as New CFO to Support Growth and Global Expansion
items.summary: Seeq Corporation named Ray Scheppach as CFO to lead its financial strategy amid rapid growth. With over 25 years of SaaS financial leadership, Scheppach’s expertise will drive sustainable expansion and innovation. This leadership change is key for stakeholders focused on Seeq’s scaling and value creation.

items.title: Ensuring Safety Through Aerospace Manufacturing Quality and Nondestructive Inspection
items.author: ndtdon.locke@gmail.com (Donald Locke)
items.summary: Aerospace manufacturing quality and nondestructive inspection (NDI) processes are critical for flight safety, with ongoing audits revealing both common and severe nonconformances. Despite challenges, continuous improvement efforts and rigorous auditing ensure high safety standards, making air travel increasingly safer over decades. Understanding these processes highlights the vital industry commitment to defect prevention.

items.title: GM to Invest $4 Billion to Boost U.S. Production of Gas and Electric Vehicles
items.summary: General Motors plans to invest $4 billion over two years in U.S. plants to expand production of both gas-powered and electric vehicles, enhancing domestic manufacturing and supporting American jobs. This move strengthens GM's leadership in the EV market and offers diverse vehicle options to meet rising customer demand.

items.title: Reshoring Initiative Reports 244,000 U.S. Manufacturing Jobs Announced in 2024
items.summary: The Reshoring Initiative's 2024 report reveals a surge of 244,000 U.S. manufacturing job announcements driven by reshoring and foreign investment, particularly in high-tech sectors. Despite early 2025's slower trends, stable policies could accelerate growth, highlighting the critical need for workforce development and competitive industrial policy.
